questions.question: What is wireless networking?
questions.explanation: Wireless: uses radio waves. Medium: air. Standard: 802.11 (WiFi). Frequency: 2.4 GHz, 5 GHz. Mobility: devices can move. Importance: ubiquitous.

questions.question: What is WiFi?
questions.explanation: WiFi: wireless standard. Technology: radio waves. Range: 100+ meters. Speed: varies by standard. Standard: 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ax. Importance: most common wireless.

questions.question: What is 802.11?
questions.explanation: Standard: defines wireless protocol. Version: a, b, g, n, ac, ax. Frequency: 2.4/5/6 GHz. Speed: increases with versions. Importance: WiFi foundation.

questions.question: What is an SSID?
questions.explanation: SSID: service set identifier. Maximum: 32 characters. Broadcast: visible by default. Hidden: not advertised. Importance: network identification.

questions.question: What is a wireless access point (AP)?
questions.explanation: AP: creates WiFi network. Broadcast: SSID transmission. Connection: multiple clients. Configuration: centralized. Importance: wireless infrastructure.

questions.question: What is a wireless router?
questions.explanation: Router: combines routing, AP, switch. Function: internet, WiFi, LAN. Typical: home network. Configuration: simple setup. Importance: home standard.

questions.question: What is Bluetooth?
questions.explanation: Bluetooth: wireless standard. Range: 10-100 meters. Purpose: device pairing. Frequency: 2.4 GHz. Version: 5.x current. Importance: device connectivity.

questions.question: What is cellular network?
questions.explanation: Cellular: coverage areas (cells). Technology: 4G, 5G. Provider: telecom companies. Mobility: nationwide. Importance: mobile data.

questions.question: What is 4G/LTE?
questions.explanation: 4G: faster than 3G. LTE: standard. Speed: 50+ Mbps typical. Coverage: wide availability. Importance: current standard.

questions.question: What is 5G?
questions.explanation: 5G: next generation. Speed: 1+ Gbps potential. Latency: very low. Coverage: rolling out. Technology: mmWave, NR. Importance: emerging standard.
